page.title: 05TOURISM
page.content: As well as Rode Hall and Little Moreton Hall,there is another hall that is becoming a tourist attraction. This is Great Moreton Hall.Resembling a castle it was built for a Nanchester cotton baron in 1841.Turned into a school in 1952 it now belongs to Manor House Hotels and was opened as a luxury hotel in 1982. Rode Heath attracts tourists boating on the Trent and Mersey canal. Sandwiched between two sets of locks the village offers mooring,shops where visitors can replenish their supplies and two pubs.The village is steeped in canal life history. The Broughton Arms having many relics of canal life on its walls.Most of the original homes belonging to Bargees survive although the industrial buildings that used to straddle the canal have sadly disappeared
